meanings.sent1: The tent we set up for the party was only temporaries.
meanings.sent2: The rental car was only meant for temporaries use.
meanings.sent3: The temporary tattoo she got for fun was definitely temporaries.
meanings.sent4: His interest in the hobby was just temporaries, like a passing cloud.
meanings.sent5: The temporary bridge was a temporaries solution to the problem.

meanings.definition: a person employed for a short period of time
meanings.sent1: The company hired temporaries to help during the busy season.
meanings.sent2: Temporaries are often brought in to cover staff shortages.
meanings.sent3: The temporaries brought a fresh perspective to the team.
meanings.sent4: She worked as a temporary, or temporaries, at various offices.
meanings.sent5: The temporaries quickly adapted to their new roles in the company.

meanings.sent1: The paint used on the walls was purposely temporaries.
meanings.sent2: The temporary fix was only temporaries and needed a permanent solution.
meanings.sent3: His temper was just a temporaries reaction to the situation.
meanings.sent4: The temporary setback was seen as just a temporaries obstacle.
meanings.sent5: The temporary exhibit was a temporaries addition to the museum.
